A computer-readable storage medium comprising instructions stored thereon that, when executed by a control circuit, cause the control circuit to:control a first lighting load in a first zone in a building to a first color setting, wherein the first color setting comprises a first correlated color temperature (CCT) value or a first full color value;in response to receiving a selection to change a current color setting of the first lighting load from the first color setting to a second color setting, control the current color setting of the first lighting load in the first zone to the second color setting, wherein the second color setting comprises a second CCT value or a second full color value;in response to an indication to save the current color setting of the first lighting load, save the second color setting of the first lighting load to a predefined set of saved color configurations;receive an indication to define a scene for controlling a second zone in the building, wherein the second zone comprises a second lighting load;while defining the scene, display the predefined set of saved color configurations for user selection to define a third color setting for controlling the second lighting load in response to an activation of the scene, wherein the predefined set of saved color configurations comprises the second color setting;in response to a selection of the second color setting in the predefined set of saved color configurations, automatically configure the third color setting for controlling the second lighting load in response to the activation of the scene to the second color setting in the predefined set of saved color configurations;receive a triggering event configured to activate the scene; andcontrol the second lighting load to the third color setting in response the triggering event.

10. The computer-readable storage medium of claim 9, wherein the first color setting comprises the first CCT value, wherein the second color setting comprises the second CCT value, wherein the predefined set of saved color configurations comprises a predefined set of CCT values, and wherein the instructions, when executed by the control circuit, further cause the control circuit to:receive an indication to display the predefined set of CCT values, wherein the predefined set of CCT values are displayed in response to receiving the indication to display the predefined set of CCT values;receive an indication to display a predefined set of full color values; andseparately display the predefined set of full color values.

11. The computer-readable storage medium of claim 9, wherein the first color setting comprises the first full color value, wherein the second color setting comprises the second full color value, wherein the predefined set of saved color configurations comprises a predefined set of full color values, and wherein the instructions, when executed by the control circuit, further cause the control circuit to:receive an indication to display the predefined set of full color values, wherein the predefined set of full color values comprising the second color setting is displayed in response to receiving the indication to display the predefined set of full color values;receive an indication to display a predefined set of CCT values; andseparately display the predefined set of CCT values.

12. The computer-readable storage medium of claim 9, wherein the instructions, when executed by the control circuit, further cause the control circuit to:receive an indication to manually configure the third color setting for controlling the second lighting load in response to the activation of the scene; andin response to the received indication to manually configure the third color setting for controlling the second lighting load, display a palette on the graphical user interface configured to allow for manual configuration of the third color setting.

13. The computer-readable storage medium of claim 12, wherein the palette is configured to display colors at different color temperatures or a full color gamut of colors at which the second lighting load is capable of being controlled, and wherein the instructions, when executed by the control circuit, further cause the control circuit to:receive, via the graphical user interface, a selection of a fourth color setting on the palette; andin response to the selection of the fourth color setting on the palette, configure the second lighting load to be controlled to the fourth color setting in response to the activation of the scene.

14. The computer-readable storage medium of claim 9, wherein the instructions, when executed by the control circuit, further cause the control circuit to:while defining the scene, receive an indication of a lighting intensity value for controlling the second lighting load in response to the activation of the scene; andcontrol the second lighting load to the lighting intensity value in response the triggering event.

15. The computer-readable storage medium of claim 14, wherein the instructions, when executed by the control circuit, further cause the control circuit to:send the lighting intensity value and the third color setting for controlling the second lighting load to a system controller for controlling the second lighting load in response to the activation of the scene.

16. The computer-readable storage medium of claim 9, wherein the instructions, when executed by the control circuit, further cause the control circuit to transmit the third color setting to a lighting control device configured to control the second lighting load.

17. A device comprising a control circuit, the control circuit configured to:control a first lighting load in a first zone in a building to a first color setting, wherein the first color setting comprises a first correlated color temperature (CCT) value or a first full color value;in response to receiving a selection to change a current color setting of the first lighting load from the first color setting to a second color setting, control the current color setting of the first lighting load in the first zone to the second color setting, wherein the second color setting comprises a second CCT value or a second full color value;in response to an indication to save the current color setting of the first lighting load, save the second color setting of the first lighting load to a predefined set of saved color configurations;receive an indication to define a scene for controlling a second zone in the building, wherein the second zone comprises a second lighting load;while defining the scene, display the predefined set of saved color configurations for user selection to define a third color setting for controlling the second lighting load in response to an activation of the scene, wherein the predefined set of saved color configurations comprises the second color setting;in response to a selection of the second color setting in the predefined set of saved color configurations, automatically configure the third color setting for controlling the second lighting load in response to the activation of the scene to the second color setting in the predefined set of saved color configurations;receive a triggering event configured to activate the scene; andcontrol the second lighting load to the third color setting in response the triggering event.

19. The device of claim 18, wherein the first color setting comprises the first full color value, wherein the second color setting comprises the second full color value, wherein the predefined set of saved color configurations comprises a predefined set of full color values, and wherein the control circuit is further configured to:receive an indication to display the predefined set of full color values, wherein the predefined set of full color values comprising the second color setting is displayed in response to receiving the indication to display the predefined set of full color values;receive an indication to display a predefined set of CCT values; andseparately display the predefined set of CCT values.

21. 22. The device of claim 18, wherein the control circuit is further configured to:while defining the scene, receive an indication of a lighting intensity value for controlling the second lighting load in response to the activation of the scene; andcontrol the second lighting load to the lighting intensity value in response the triggering event.

23. The device of claim 22, wherein the control circuit is further configured to:send the lighting intensity value and the third color setting for controlling the second lighting load to a system controller for controlling the second lighting load in response to the activation of the scene.
24. The device of claim 18, wherein the control circuit is further configured to transmit the third color setting to a lighting control device configured to control the second lighting load.
